SENT.plain: A rare case of pregnancy in a patient with Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber syndrome is described
The arterio-venous anomalies in this patient originally occurred in her left leg
A Cesarean section was performed at term
There were no signs of intravascular coagulation or cardiac decompensation
Prophylactic anticoagulant treatment was given during the 3rd trimester and into the early puerperium The clinical course and the risks of a pregnancy with this condition are discussed
Conclusion: Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome was once thought to be a contraindication to pregnancy
With careful management, successful pregnancies can be achieved
